intro: Amoora stellatosquamosa, commonly known as the star-scaled amora, is a tropical evergreen tree native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its distinctive star-shaped leaf scars and rough, scaly bark. The plant produces small, fragrant flowers that are typically white or pale yellow, followed by round, fleshy fruits. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland forests. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a landscape plant.
